tag.name: cfmail
tag.help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.

parameter.name: cc
parameter.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message

parameter.name: bcc
parameter.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message, without listing them in the message header.

parameter.name: subject
parameter.help: Message subject. Can be dynamically generated.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type

parameter.name: mimeattach
parameter.help: Path of file to attach to message. Attached file is MIME-encoded. CFML attempts to determine the MIME type of the file; use the cfmailparam tag to send an attachement and specify the MIME type.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for message(s). Use this attribute to send more than one message, or to send query results within a message.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Query column to use when you group sets of records to send as a message. For example, to send a set of billing statements to a customer, group on "Customer_ID." Case-sensitive. Eliminates adjacent duplicates when data is sorted by the specified field.

parameter.name: groupcasesensitive
parameter.help: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Row in a query to start from.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: SMTP server address, or (Enterprise edition only) a comma-delimited list of server addresses, to use for sending messages. At least one server must be specified here or in the CFML MX Administrator. A value here overrides the Administrator. A value that includes a port specification overrides the port attribute. See the Usage section for details.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: TCP/IP port on which SMTP server listens for requests (normally 25). A value here overrides the Administrator.

parameter.name: mailerid
parameter.help: Mailer ID to be passed in X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: * Yes: sends debugging output to standard output. By default, if the console window is unavailable, ColdFusion sends output to cf_root\runtime\logs\coldfusion-out.log on server configurations. On J2EE configurations, with JRun, the default location is jrun_home/logs/servername-out.log. * No: does not generate debugging output.
